title: Vic Premier Called A Bully, Zuckerberg‚Äôs Social Media Trial, Qld Labelled Worst Nightlife | 10 News+

title: Bayer Offers $7.25 Billion To Settle Cancer Claims | 10 News
description: German drug giant Bayer has offered to pay US$7.25 billion to settle numerous lawsuits claiming its weedkiller Roundup caused cancer.  The product was a popular staple in households since the 1970s, but was identified as a probable human carcinogen by the World Health Organization in 2015.  10‚Äôs Late News explains. title: Former Prince Andrew Leaves Custody After Arrest, But Remains Under Investigation | 10 News
description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has been pictured leaving police custody after his arrest on suspicion of misconduct in public office over allegations he sent confidential government documents to Jeffrey Epstein.  The former prince was seen reclined in the back of a vehicle departing Aylsham police station shortly after 7pm GMT.  Thames Valley Police confirmed searches in Norfolk have now ended as investigations continue.  He has previously denied any wrongdoing and has not responded to requests for comment on the latest allegations. title: Giuffre Family ‚ÄòVindicated‚Äô After Former Prince Andrew Arrested Over Epstein Ties | 10 News
description: The family of Virginia Giuffre say they feel ‚Äúvindicated‚Äù after Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office over allegations he shared confidential documents with Jeffrey Epstein.  Giuffre‚Äôs brother Sky Roberts said he was overcome with emotion, calling the arrest a moment of ‚Äúcelebration‚Äù for his late sister, who died by suicide in May 2025.  The former prince, who turned 66 on Thursday, was questioned by Thames Valley Police over claims he passed documents to Epstein while serving as a trade envoy.  Although he has been released from custody, investigations remain ongoing.  King Charles said the family would offer ‚Äúfull and wholehearted support and cooperation‚Äù to authorities, while Mountbatten-Windsor has previously denied wrongdoing and has not commented on the latest allegations. title: Former Prince Andrew Returns Home As Misconduct Investigations Continue | 10 News
description: Former prince Andrew has been arrested by UK police on his 66th birthday.    The King's disgraced younger brother was taken away for questioning over alleged misconduct in public office amid the Epstein scandal.  After spending 10 hours in police custody a photo shows him trying to hide as he was released without charge pending further investigation.
